section.para: Documentary Collection is a method of payment used in international trade, whereby the exporter entrusts the handling of trade documents to banks and gives the banks instructions concerning the release of these documents to the importer. The two most common conditions for release are:

listitem.para: Documents will be released only if the importer makes immediate payment according to the contracted agreement between the exporter and the importer. Also known as a sight Collection.
Documents will be released only if the importer accepts the accompanying draft, thereby incurring an obligation to pay at a specified future date. Also known as a term Collection.

section.para: The main advantages of Documentary Collection are that it is less complicated and less expensive than Letters of Credit - the documents are only released to the importer who needs them to fetch the goods when the payment or acceptance has been effected.
However, this method presents a greater risk to the exporter than do Letters of Credit, since no formal guarantee of payment is attached to its terms.
From its inception by the exporter to its ultimate recipient, the importer, the following parties are involved in a Documentary Collection:

listitem.para: The exporter (also known as the seller), who authorizes a bank (the Remitting Bank) to handle documents on its behalf.
The bank that the exporter authorizes to carry out the Collection on its behalf.
Any bank, other than the Remitting Bank, involved in obtaining payment or acceptance from the importer (drawee).
The Collecting Bank that presents the documents to the importer (drawee), usually the importer's bank.
The importer (also known as the buyer), who is presented with documents (financial and/or commercial) for the purpose of either payment or acceptance, in accordance with the Collection instructions.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, the terms "EC", "Export Collection" and "Export Documentary Collection" are used interchangeably. The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Step-by-Step Process
section.para: The classical flow of a transaction under a Documentary Collection is:

listitem.para: A sales contract is established with the buyer, whereby it is agreed that payment will be made by Documentary Collection.
The delivery of goods to the transport company (air/sea/land) is arranged by the exporter. He obtains transport documents from the carrier and prepares other documents as agreed with the importer.
The request to process the Collection is communicated to the Remitting Bank in one of two ways:

Regular Collection Instruction: the exporter gives a manually generated letter accompanied by the documents providing instructions on how to process the Collection to his Remitting Bank. This banks sends them on to the Presenting Bank.

Direct Collection Instruction: the exporter sends the documents directly to the Presenting Bank, often located in the country of the importer. He includes a cover letter bearing the Remitting Bank logo and indicating that they send the documents on its behalf. This method is usually used by exporters who settle large volumes of transactions through Collections.

The next step depends on the importer's response to the presentation of documents (payment, non-payment, acceptance of the bill of exchange, non-acceptance, protest, renegotiation, alternate buyer, etc.).

section.title: Overview
section.para: The (EC) module enables you, on behalf of your company (which is the drawer and seller and exporter) to initiate Documentary Collection requests, submit them to your chosen Remitting Bank, and subsequently amend, follow up and maintain them and exchange messages about them with this bank.

section.title: Export Collection Functions
section.para: The menu for this module has the following groups of functions. All are basically as described in the chapter Functions.

listitem.para: Submit D/A and D/P collection instructions as regular (documents sent to the Remitting Bank by Courier) or direct (instructions only sent to the Remitting Bank, documents sent directly to the importer's Presenting Bank).

section.title: EC Initiation
section.para: This section describes the EC Initiation part of the menu and the forms it uses.

section.title: EC Initiation Options
section.para:
This part of the menu contains several options, providing different ways to request an Export Collection.
Regular Collection
Create an Export Collection request for a regular collection from a blank form.
Direct Collection - Bank
Create an EC request for a direct collection from a blank form that would be approved by the Bank and sent to you (customer) for printing.
Direct Collection - Customer
Create an EC request for a direct collection from a blank form without the Bank’s approval. You can print it directly.
From Template
Create an EC request from a template that you have previously created. Most of the information for the transaction defaults to the values set in the template except for key data such as the expiry date, currency and amount of the new EC.
Copy From EC
Create an EC by copying values from an existing record.
Edit Transactions
Review, complete and submit records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.
Retrieve Unsigned
Review and submit records that another user has created, however, has not been able to submit due to lack of authority.

important.para: There are a few conditions that must be met for the licenses to be displayed in the popup. The following provides information for the conditions that could point to reasons that make licenses available or not available in the popup:

listitem.para: You should have created license(s) and linked it to the beneficiary selected in the Drawee Details section on this page. If you have selected a drawee for whom there are no licenses created, the popup will display a blank list. (This condition applies only if your administrator has selected Non-Principal Only in the License Definition. For any other selection, all licenses are available.)

Your selection of the Tenor for the EC from the general details section should be within the valid to and from date of the license. Only licenses that match this criterion are displayed. If the Tenor is beyond the license validity date, the list displays blank.

Your selection of multi-currency during license creation will allow you to select a currency in the Collection Amount field that is different from the license currency and display the license in the popup. However, if multi-currency has not been selected, then the currency in the Collection Amount field has to be the same as the license field for the license to be available in the popup.

section.para: Once you have selected a license, you have to enter a value in the Allocated Amount field that is equal to the collection amount of the EC (refer to Amount Details section). If the amount available for the license is less than the collection amount of the EC, you have to add and link one or more licenses to fill for the deficit.

section.title: EC Initiation - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows an Export Collection record that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of Export Collection records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click in the System Id column to open the message in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: From Existing EC Form - Licenses
section.para: Click on the Link License button and the List of licenses appears. Use System ID and License Number fields to narrow down your search.

important.para: There are a few conditions that must be met for the licenses to be displayed in the popup. The following provides information for the conditions that could point to reasons that make licenses available or not available in the popup:

listitem.para: You should have created license(s) and linked it to the beneficiary selected in the Drawee Details section on this page. If you have selected a drawee for whom there are no licenses created, the popup will display a blank list. (This condition applies only if your administrator has selected Non-Principal Only in the License Definition. For any other selection, all licenses are available.)

Your selection of the Tenor for the EC from the general details section should be within the valid to and from date of the license. Only licenses that match this criterion are displayed. If the Tenor is beyond the license validity date, the list displays blank.

Your selection of multi-currency during license creation will allow you to select a currency in the Collection Amount field that is different from the license currency and display the license in the popup. However, if multi-currency has not been selected, then the currency in the Collection Amount field has to be the same as the license field for the license to be available in the popup.

section.para: Once you have selected a license, you have to enter a value in the Allocated Amount field that is equal to the collection amount of the EC (refer to Amount Details section). If the amount available for the license is less than the collection amount of the EC, you have to add and link one or more licenses to fill for the deficit.

If you have already linked a license, the details are displayed for System ID, Back Office Reference, License Number and Allocated Amount. You can choose to delete a linked license by clicking the Delete
icon in the right-hand column.

section.title: EC Amendment - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: When selected, this option will present a list of amended ECs that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges.
Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing. For more details on the fields, refer to the section EC Amendment - From Existing EC Form.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records. The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then displayed.

section.title: Message to Bank
section.para: This section describes the Message to Bank function and the forms it uses.

section.title: Message to Bank Options
section.para: This part of the menu contains several options, providing different ways to send a free-format update message regarding an existing Export Collection to the Remitting Bank.
A typical use of this function could be to send your protest instructions to the Remitting Bank after an advice of refusal has been received from the Collecting Bank.

The options associated with this menu item are the same as when preparing a free-format message for the other products. See the section Message to Bank in the chapter Import Letter of Credit if you need further details on the options summarised below.
From Existing EC
Amend an Existing EC.
Action Required
Review and request action from customers for EC records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.
Edit Transactions
Review, complete and submit EC records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.
Retrieve Unsigned
Review and submit records EC that you or another user have created, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Bank Reference, Drawee or Currency field.

section.title: EC Maintenance
section.para: This function is user to maintain Export Collection records that were created, but are no longer required in the system.

section.title: EC Maintenance - Set Entity
section.para: List all ECs and associate an Entity. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click Set Entity and then select System ID. You can now associate an entity for the EC by clicking the search icon
from the Entity field. Click the Submit button to complete the changes.

section.title: EC Maintenance - Set Reference
section.para: Assign a customer reference to an EC record that currently has none.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign a reference to the record.

note.para: This action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix. All transactions of the current files are updated.

section.title: EC Maintenance - Unsigned ECs
section.para: List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) Export Collection transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (unauthorised). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: EC Maintenance - Purged ECs
section.para: List and optionally delete Export Collection records transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: EC Maintenance - Rejected ECs
section.para: List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of Export Collection records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
